Are bears even good to eat in the spring? All I've ever heard was that the best eating bears are shot in the fall when they've fattened up..... Please explain.
other way around, the leaner the better.
the only difference will be. that bears that are destroyed will be accounted for in a licence fee. . non-residents have always made up the majority..

Even with a bear season I am not sure I would hunt them. The few times I had Bear meat it just didn't taste good to me. I don't think I would go to the expense to have the hide cured or a head mount because it isn't something that would have a place in my house.   Art

Are bears even good to eat in the spring? All I've ever heard was that the best eating bears are shot in the fall when they've fattened up..... Please explain.   other way around, the leaner the better.  it depends, age, diet and how the meat was handled/processed....I'd take a fat fall berry bear over a skinny spring any day....bear fat is amazing, makes the best pastry dough, lots of uses for it  the bear meat/fat that tastes horrible comes from dump bears and salmon bears....those stinky things are not the best shooters
Be nice to see more moose calves...  Who knows..  this might help increase the returns..
Actually I've seen on that show "the meat hunter"' on oln, the guy target bears that gorge on blueberries, and apparently the meat is like pork, and the fat has many uses.... Very cool.
